edu.rit.crypto

Class RC4

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.crypto.RC4
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    StreamCipher

    public class RC4
extends Object
implements StreamCipher
    Class RC4 provides an object that computes the RC4 stream cipher.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RC4(byte[] key)
      Construct a new RC4 stream cipher object and set the key.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int encrypt(int b)
      Encrypt or decrypt the given byte.
      int keySize()
      Returns this stream cipher's key size in bytes.
      void setKey(byte[] key)
      Set the key for this stream cipher.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • RC4

        public RC4(byte[] key)
        Construct a new RC4 stream cipher object and set the key. key must be an array of bytes whose length is equal to keySize(). Class RC4 supports a fixed key size of 16 bytes (128 bits). The keystream generator is initialized, such that successive calls to encrypt() will encrypt or decrypt a series of bytes.
        Parameters:
        key - Key.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if key is null.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if key.length ≠ keySize().

    • Method Detail

      • keySize

        public int keySize()
        Returns this stream cipher's key size in bytes. Class RC4 supports a fixed key size of 16 bytes (128 bits).
        Specified by:
        keySize in interface StreamCipher
        Returns:
        Key size.

      • setKey

        public void setKey(byte[] key)
        Set the key for this stream cipher. key must be an array of bytes whose length is equal to keySize(). Class RC4 supports a fixed key size of 16 bytes (128 bits). The keystream generator is initialized, such that successive calls to encrypt() will encrypt or decrypt a series of bytes.
        Specified by:
        setKey in interface StreamCipher
        Parameters:
        key - Key.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if key is null.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if key.length ≠ keySize().

      • encrypt

        public int encrypt(int b)
        Encrypt or decrypt the given byte. Only the least significant 8 bits of b are used. If b is a plaintext byte, the ciphertext byte is returned as a value from 0 to 255. If b is a ciphertext byte, the plaintext byte is returned as a value from 0 to 255.
        Specified by:
        encrypt in interface StreamCipher
        Parameters:
        b - Plaintext byte (if encrypting), ciphertext byte (if decrypting).
        Returns:
        Ciphertext byte (if encrypting), plaintext byte (if decrypting).
